---
- name: Configure Nginx
  hosts: webserver
  become: yes

  tasks:
    - name: Install Nginx
      apt:
        name: nginx
        state: present

    - name: Start Nginx service
      service:
        name: nginx
        state: started
        enabled: yes

    - name: Copy custom Nginx config
      copy:
        src: files/nginx.conf
        dest: /etc/nginx/nginx.conf
        owner: root
        group: root
        mode: 0644
      notify:
        - Restart Nginx
  handlers:
    - name: Restart Nginx
      service:
        name: nginx
        state: restarted

Algoritmo CajeroAutomatico
    Definir monto, cantidad100k, cantidad50k, cantidad20k, cantidad10k como Entero
    
    Escribir "Ingrese el monto a retirar: "
    Leer monto
    
    cantidad100k <- monto / 100000
    monto <- monto MOD 100000
    
    cantidad50k <- monto / 50000
    monto <- monto MOD 50000
    
    cantidad20k <- monto / 20000
    monto <- monto MOD 20000
    
    cantidad10k <- monto / 10000
    monto <- monto MOD 10000
    
    Escribir "Cantidad de billetes a entregar:"
    Escribir "100.000: ", cantidad100k
    Escribir "50.000: ", cantidad50k
    Escribir "20.000: ", cantidad20k
    Escribir "10.000: ", cantidad10k
    
FinAlgoritmo

# 定义主管道
jobs:
- job: Build
  displayName: 'Build and Package MAUI iOS'
  pool:
    vmImage: 'macos-latest'

  steps:
  - task: UseDotNet@2
    displayName: 'Install .NET 6.0 SDK'
    inputs:
      packageType: sdk
      version: '6.x'
      includePreviewVersions: true

  - task: InstallAppleCertificate@2
    displayName: 'Install Apple Developer Certificate'
    inputs:
      certSecureFile: '$(APPLE_CERTIFICATE_SECUREFILE)'
      certPwd: '$(APPLE_CERTIFICATE_PASSWORD)'
      keychain: 'temp'

  - task: InstallAppleProvisioningProfile@1
    displayName: 'Install Provisioning Profile'
    inputs:
      provisioningProfileLocation: 'secureFiles'
      provProfileSecureFile: '$(PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SECUREFILE)'
      removeProfileWithSameName: true

  - script: |
      dotnet restore
      dotnet build --configuration $(BuildConfiguration) --no-restore
      dotnet publish --configuration $(BuildConfiguration) --output $(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/$(OutputPath) --no-build
    displayName: 'Build and Publish'

  - task: ArchiveFiles@2
    displayName: 'Archive Published Files'
    inputs:
      rootFolderOrFile: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/$(OutputPath)'
      includeRootFolder: false
      archiveFile: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/$(OutputPath).zip'
      replaceExistingArchive: true

  - task: PublishPipelineArtifact@1
    inputs:
      artifactName: 'iOS App'
      targetPath: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/$(OutputPath).zip'
      publishLocation: 'pipeline'

local creature = Entities:FindByName(nil, "название_существа")

-- Проверяем наличие Aghanim's Scepter у владельца и изменяем свойство "AttackCapabilities" существа
if creature and creature:GetOwner():HasScepter() then
    creature:SetAttackCapability(DOTA_UNIT_CAP_MELEE_ATTACK) -- Здесь можно изменить тип атаки, например, на DOTA_UNIT_CAP_RANGED_ATTACK
else
    creature:SetAttackCapability(DOTA_UNIT_CAP_NO_ATTACK)
end

    displayName: 'Build MAUI iOS app'

  - task: PublishPipelineArtifact@0
    inputs:
      targetPath: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/mauiiOS'
      artifact: 'mauiiOS'
      publishLocation: 'pipeline'

trigger:
  branches:
    exclude:
      - '*'

jobs:
- job: BuildAndPackage
  displayName: 'Build and Package'
  pool:
    vmImage: 'macOS-10.15'

  steps:
  - task: UseDotNet@2
    displayName: 'Use .NET Core SDK'
    inputs:
      version: '6.x'
  
  - script: dotnet clean path/to/your/maui/project.csproj --configuration Release
    displayName: 'Clean maui iOS project'
  
  - script: dotnet msbuild path/to/your/maui/project.csproj --configuration Release /p:Platform=iPhoneSimulator /p:OutputPath=$(build.artifactstagingdirectory)
    displayName: 'Build maui iOS project'
  
  - task: CopyFiles@2
    displayName: 'Copy .app files to staging directory'
    inputs:
      SourceFolder: '$(build.artifactstagingdirectory)/path/to/your/maui/project/bin/iPhoneSimulator/Release/'
      Contents: '**/*'
      TargetFolder: '$(build.artifactstagingdirectory)'
  
  - task: PublishBuildArtifacts@1
    displayName: 'Publish Artifact'
    inputs:
      PathtoPublish: '$(build.artifactstagingdirectory)'
      ArtifactName: 'mauiApp'

- script: dotnet clean YourProject.csproj
  displayName: 'Clean Project'
- task: NuGetCommand@2
  inputs:
    command: 'restore'
    restoreSolution: 'YourSolution.sln'

- task: DeleteFiles@1
  inputs:
    SourceFolder: '$(build.artifactstagingdirectory)'
    Contents: '**/*'
    RemoveSourceFolder: true
  displayName: 'Clean Project Outputs'
- task: NuGetCommand@2
  inputs:
    command: 'restore'
    restoreSolution: 'YourSolution.sln'

---
- name: Install docker
  hosts: remote_machines
  become: true

  tasks:
    - name: Install required packages
      apt:
        name: ['apt-transport-https', 'ca-certificates', 'curl', 'gnupg-agent', 'software-properties-common']
        state: present

    - name: Add Docker GPG key
      apt_key:
        url: https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg
        state: present

    - name: Add Docker repository
      apt_repository:
        repo: deb [arch=amd64] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu {{ ansible_distribution_release }} stable
        state: present

    - name: Install Docker Engine
      apt:
        name: docker-ce
        state: present

version: '3'

services:

  mongo:

      - MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME=myuser

    ports:
      - "27017:27017"

  nginx:
    build: ./nginx
    ports:
      - "80:80"
    depends_on:
      - storage

(defun c:setLayerStateToAll ()
  (setq layerState (vla-get-layerstates (vla-get-activedocument (vlax-get-acad-object))))
  (setq selectedLayerState (car (entsel "\nSelect Layer State: ")))
  
  (vlax-for doc (vla-get-documents (vlax-get-acad-object))
    (vla-activate doc)
    (vla-get-layers doc); Activate each document and get its Layers collection
    
    (if (vla-get-layerstate doc selectedLayerState) ; Verify if selected layer state exists in the document
      (vla-restore doc selectedLayerState) ; Restore the selected layer state
      (prompt "\nSelected layer state doesn't exist in the document")
    )
  )
  
  (vla-activate (vlax-get-property (vlax-get-acad-object) 'ActiveDocument))
)

(defun c:gather-data ()
  (setq layer (getstring "\nEnter layer name: "))
  (setq csv-file (getfiled "Save CSV File" nil "CSV Files (*.csv)"))
  
  (setq data '("Object Type" "Area" "Length")) ; Header of CSV file
  
  (setq csv-str "") ; Initialize CSV string
  
  (vlax-for obj (vlax-invoke (vla-get-activedocument (vlax-get-acad-object)) 'ModelSpace)
    (if (= layer (vla-get-layer obj))
      (progn
        (if (= "HATCH" (vla-get-objectname obj))
          (progn
            (setq area (vla-get-area obj))
            (setq data (append data (list (vla-get-objectname obj) area)))
          )
        )
        (if (or (= "LINE" (vla-get-objectname obj)) (= "LWPOLYLINE" (vla-get-objectname obj)))
          (progn
            (setq length (vla-get-length obj))
            (setq data (append data (list (vla-get-objectname obj) length)))
          )
        )
      )
    )
  )
  
  (foreach item data
    (setq csv-str (strcat csv-str (vl-string-quote (strcase (car item))) "," (vl-princ-to-string (cadr item)) ","))
  )
  
  (setq csv-file (open csv-file "w"))
  (write-line csv-str csv-file)
  (close csv-file)
  
  (princ "\nData gathering complete. CSV file saved.")
)

(defun c:test-gather-data ()
  (c:gather-data)
  (princ)
)

(c:test-gather-data)

(defun c:gather-data ()
  (setq layer (getstring "\nEnter layer name: "))
  (setq csv-file (strcat (vl-filename-directory (getenv "TEMP")) "\\data.csv"))

  (if (tblobjname "LAYER" layer)
    (progn
      (setq data '("Object Type" "Area" "Length")) ; Header of the CSV file

      (defun add-to-data (ent)
        (if (eq "AcDbHatch" (vla-get-objectname ent))
          (progn
            (setq area (vla-get-Area ent))
            (setq data (append data (list "HATCH" area)))
          ))
        (if (or (eq "AcDbLine" (vla-get-objectname ent))
                (eq "AcDbPolyline" (vla-get-objectname ent)))
          (progn
            (setq length (vla-get-TrueLength ent))
            (setq data (append data (list (vla-get-objectname ent) length)))
          ))
        )

      (setq acadApp (vlax-get-acad-object))
      (setq doc (vla-get-activatedocument acadApp))
      (setq ms (vla-get-modelspace doc))

      (setq csv-str "") ; Initialize CSV string

      (vlax-for ent ms ; Iterate over entities in ModelSpace
        (setq current-layer (vla-get-layer ent))
        (if (and (= (vla-get-objectname current-layer) "AcDbLayerTableRecord")
                 (equal (vla-get current-layer 'name) layer))
          (add-to-data ent)
        )
      )

      (foreach item data
        (setq csv-str (strcat csv-str (vl-string-quote (strcase (car item))) "," (vl-princ-to-string (cadr item)) ","))
        )

      (setq csv-file (vl-file-syst-write csv-file csv-str))

      (princ "\nData gathering complete. CSV file saved on the desktop.")
    )
    (princ "\nSpecified layer does not exist.")
  )
)

(defun c:test-gather-data ()
  (c:gather-data)
  (princ)
)

(c:test-gather-data)

(defun c:getLayerName ()
  (setq selObj (car (entsel "\nSelect an object: ")))

  (vl-load-com)
  (setq acadObj (vla-get-ActiveDocument (vlax-get-acad-object)))
  (setq entityObj (vlax-ename->vla-object selObj))
  (setq layerName (vla-get-layer entityObj))

  (princ (strcat "Layer name: " layerName))
)

%H:get the transition rate of system physical configuration change from S'to S during time interval Δt
H=zeros(3,3,3,3,3,3);  % Define a 6-dimensional array to store the transition rates of the system physical configuration changes
...

% G:conditional probability of system process variables going from cell j'into j under system configuration s' during time period Δt.
G=zeros(3,3,3,5,5);  % Define a 5-dimensional array to store the conditional probabilities of system process variables
...

%time step k --- system being in end state
P=1; % Initialize the system probability with 1, assuming the system is in the initial state

%time step k-1 --- trace normal system states leading to the end state
G_1=G(:,:,:,2:4,1); % Extract the conditional probabilities for system process variables going from normal control cells at time (k-1)Δt to the failed state at kΔt

% Initialize iterator variable
ind=find(G_1~=0);  % Get the indices of non-zero elements in the matrix G_1

% Initial guess for preallocation
P_cyc=P*G_1(ind);  % Loop variable: represents the probability of system state transitions from normal control cells at time (k-1)Δt to the failed state at kΔt

k=1;  % Number of time steps to be considered in iteration analysis
for r=k:-1:1      
    
    for N=1:1:length(ind)     
        % Get the subscripts of elements in matrix G_1
        [i(N),j(N),f(N),h(N)]=ind2sub(size(G),ind(N));  % Convert indices of elements in matrix G to subscripts
        h(N)=h(N)+1;   % Add 1 to the system initial state h for values ranging from 2~4 instead of 1~3
        Sub_cell{N,1}=[i(N),j(N),f(N),h(N)];    % Construct a cell array with the subscripts of elements in matrix G
        
        % Calculate the transition probability Q by multiplying conditional probability G and transition rate H
        H_cell{N,1}=H(:,:,:,i(N),j(N),f(N));   
        G_cell{N,1}=G(:,:,:,2:4,h(N));    
        Q_cell{N,1}=bsxfun(@times,H_cell{N,1},G_cell{N,1});  % Get the transition rate Qij of process variables given different system state configurations
        
        % Calculate the probability of sequential paths along the branching process
        P_cell{N,1}=bsxfun(@times,P_cyc(N,1),Q_cell{N,1});   % Get the probabilities of all routes (cell array P_cell contains both possible system branches and infeasible paths)
        Pind_cell{N,1}=find(0<P_cell{N,1}&P_cell{N,1}<=1);   % System branch pruning. Search for elements in cell array Pind_cell to check if their values reach the specified minimum truncation level
        Prob{N,1}=P_cell{N,1}(Pind_cell{N,1});  % Store probabilities of these branches that could lead to the system end state in cell array Prob     
        
        RN=[r,N];  % Output something through loops just to confirm that the code is not stuck in an infinite loop
        disp(RN);
    end
    
    % Passing the calculated values to loop variables 
    % Loop variables
    ind=cell2mat(Pind_cell);      % Convert cell array Pind_cell into a matrix to be used as a loop variable 
    P_cyc=cell2mat(Prob);   % Replace and update probabilities of system branches for subsequent branching process
end

t(r)=toc;  % Count the runtime for every iteration

        TRUE(),
        FALSE()

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: web
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      io.kompose.service: web
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        io.kompose.service: web
    spec:
      containers:
        - image: nginx:latest
          name: web
          ports:
            - containerPort: 80
          resources: {}
          volumeMounts:
            - mountPath: /usr/share/nginx/html
              name: web-hostpath0
      restartPolicy: Always
      volumes:
        - hostPath:
            path: /path/to/your/local/html    # This path will be the absolute path of your html directory on your host
          name: web-hostpath0

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: chatgpt-next-web-psfofcgv
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: chatgpt-next-web-psfofcgv
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: chatgpt-next-web-psfofcgv
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: chatgpt-next-web-psfofcgv
        image: yidadaa/chatgpt-next-web
        env:
          - name: OPENAI_API_KEY
            valueFrom:
              secretKeyRef:
                name: chatgpt-next-web-secrets
                key: OPENAI_API_KEY
          # Add other environment variables with secretKeyRef or configMapKeyRef
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3000
        resources:
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 102Mi
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 1024Mi

kind: Service
metadata:
  name: chatgpt-next-web-psfofcgv
spec:
  selector:
    app: chatgpt-next-web-psfofcgv
  ports:
  - port: 3000
    targetPort: 3000
    protocol: TCP

  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: nginx  # 选择标签为 app=nginx 的 Pod
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: nginx  # 添加标签 app=nginx
        env: production
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: nginx
          image: nginx:1.19
          ports:
            - containerPort: 80

affinity:
  nodeAffinity:
    preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
      - preference:
          matchExpressions:
            - key: runner-name
              operator: In
              values:
                - "wesql-runner-arm"
        weight: 100

affinity:
  nodeAffinity:
    requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
      nodeSelectorTerms:
        - matchExpressions:
          - key: <label-key>
            operator: In
            values:
              - <label-value>

data Tree a = Leaf | Node (Tree a) a (Tree a) deriving Show

balance :: Ord a => [a] -> Tree a
balance [] = Leaf
balance xs = let (left, right) = splitInHalf xs
             in Node (balance left) (middleElement xs) (balance right)

splitInHalf :: [a] -> ([a], [a])
splitInHalf xs = splitAt (length xs `div` 2) xs

middleElement :: [a] -> a
middleElement xs = xs !! (length xs `div` 2)

data Tree a = Leaf a | Node (Tree a) a (Tree a)

splitList :: [a] -> ([a], [a])
splitList [] = ([], [])
splitList [x] = ([x], [])
splitList (x:y:zs) = let (xs, ys) = splitList zs in (x:xs, y:ys)

balance :: Ord a => [a] -> Tree a
balance [] = Leaf
balance xs = let (left, right) = splitList xs
             in Node (balance left) (head right) (balance (tail right))

Prompt: Create two distinctive game ability icons for a fantasy setting using consistent style and vibrant details. They should be easily recognizable and relate to the abilities' themes.

1. Icon for the "Homunculus Summoning" active ability, named "Alchemical Ally" or "Homunculus Creation": Depict the silhouette of a magical flask or alembic with colorful and mystical vapors emanating from it, signifying the act of creation. Include a small creature's shadow with glowing eyes inside to suggest an enigmatic servant.

2. Icon for the "Enemy Transmutation" passive ability, named "Golden Strike" or "Alchemical Transmutation": Draw a gold coin or bar adorned with arcane runes or sparkles around it. Consider integrating an eye gazing intently overhead the coin, symbolizing the attentive effect that can turn enemies into gold during combat.

Ensure each icon remains clear and understandable at a glance, suitable for a game UI, considering the summoning, duration, and transmutation themes.

Prompt: Design two fantasy-themed ability icons that are clearly identifiable, with elements suggesting their in-game effects for a consistent visual style. Both icons should be simple enough to be understood at small sizes for a game interface.

1. Icon for the "Critical Hit Enhancement" active ability, named "Cutting Edge" or "Critical Apex": Visualization of two crossed swords with an arrowhead, both emitting sparks or glows to indicate an increased sharpness and critical hit potential. Add a clockwork motif or a circular time scale around them to denote the duration aspect of the ability enhancement.

2. Icon for the "Evasion" passive ability, named "Shadow Dance" or "Evasion Mastery": Silhouette of a hero gracefully maneuvering around sharp arrows outlines, representing incoming attacks that the character can avoid. Illustrate this with wavy lines or a blurred silhouette effect to highlight the elusive nature of the ability.

These icons should visually reflect the concepts of 'duration' and 'evasion' effectively and should be made with care to suit the mystical and adventurous ambiance of the game.

section .data
    qArray times 20 dq 0       ; Array to store the popped numbers
    qSum dq 0                  ; Variable to store the sum

section .text
    global _start

_start:
    ; Loop to sum the numbers
    mov ecx, 100                ; Set loop counter to 100
    mov eax, 5                  ; Set starting number
    mov edx, 8                  ; Set number size in bytes
    xor qSum, qSum              ; Clear the qSum variable
    
    sum_loop:
        add qSum, eax           ; Add eax to qSum
        add eax, 5              ; Increment eax by 5 for the next iteration
        loop sum_loop           ; Repeat the loop until ecx becomes zero
    
    ; Loop to push numbers onto the stack and pop them into the array
    mov ecx, 20                 ; Set loop counter to 20
    mov eax, 100                ; Set starting number
    mov edx, 8                  ; Set number size in bytes
    mov edi, qArray             ; Set edi to point to the first element of qArray
    
    push_pop_loop:
        push eax                ; Push eax onto the stack
        pop qword [edi]         ; Pop the top of the stack into qArray[edi]
        add edi, 8              ; Increment edi by 8 to point to the next element
        sub eax, 5              ; Decrement eax by 5 for the next iteration
        loop push_pop_loop      ; Repeat the loop until ecx becomes zero
    
    ; Program end
    mov eax, 1                  ; System call number for exit
    xor ebx, ebx                ; Exit code 0
    int 0x80                   ; Call the kernel

name: UpgradePlugin
version: 1.0
main: com.example.upgradeplugin.UpgradePlugin
api-version: 1.12
description: A plugin that upgrades CrackShot items
author: YourName
depend: [CrackShot]

commands:
  upgrade:
    description: Upgrade a CrackShot item
    usage: /upgrade
    permission: upgradeplugin.upgrade

permissions:
  upgradeplugin.upgrade:
    description: Allows players to use the /upgrade command
    default: true

A
     / \
    B   C
   /     \
  D       F
   \
    E

% 定义参数
N = 10000;  % 生成10000个随机数
mu1 = 0;   % 第一个正态分布的均值
mu2 = 5;   % 第二个正态分布的均值
sigma1 = 1; % 第一个正态分布的标准差
sigma2 = 2; % 第二个正态分布的标准差
p = 0.5;   % n=1的概率为0.5

% 生成两个正态分布的随机数
X = normrnd(mu1, sigma1, [N, 1]); % 生成N个符合均值为mu1，标准差为sigma1的正态分布的随机数
Y = normrnd(mu2, sigma2, [N, 1]); % 生成N个符合均值为mu2，标准差为sigma2的正态分布的随机数

% 根据概率p生成混合高斯分布的随机数
n_values = [5, 10, 20, 50]; % 不同n值
num_groups = 1000; % 组数
U_values = zeros(num_groups, length(n_values)); % 保存不同n值下的U值

for i = 1:length(n_values)
    n = n_values(i); % 当前n值
    Z = zeros(num_groups, n); % 保存随机数的矩阵
    
    for j = 1:num_groups
        n_random = rand(n, 1) < p; % 每组的随机数n
        Z(j, :) = X + n_random.*Y; % 根据n生成混合高斯分布的随机数Zij
    end
    
    for j = 1:num_groups
        U_values(j, i) = (1/(n*DZ)) * sum(Z(j, :) - n*EZ); % 计算每组数据的U值
    end
end

% 画出频率分布直方图
figure;
for i = 1:length(n_values)
    subplot(length(n_values), 1, i);
    histogram(U_values(:, i), 'Normalization', 'probability'); % 绘制频率分布直方图
    xlabel('U');
    ylabel('Probability');
    title(['Frequency Distribution of U (n = ' num2str(n_values(i)) ')']);
end

sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant AuthorizationServer
    participant ResourceServer
    participant User

    Client->>AuthorizationServer: Send Authorization Request
    AuthorizationServer->>User: Redirect to Login
    User->>AuthorizationServer: Provide Credentials
    AuthorizationServer-->>User: Authenticate User
    User-->>AuthorizationServer: Grant access
    AuthorizationServer->>Client: Redirect to Callback URL with Authorization Code
    Client->>AuthorizationServer: Exchange Authorization Code for Access Token
    AuthorizationServer-->>Client: Access Token
    Client->>ResourceServer: Send Request with Access Token
    ResourceServer->>AuthorizationServer: Validate Access Token
    AuthorizationServer-->>ResourceServer: Access Token Validation Result
    ResourceServer-->>Client: Respond with Resource

graph LR A((Client)) -- Authorization Request --> B((Authorization Server)) B -- Redirect to Login --> C{User} C -- Provide Credentials --> B B -- Authenticate User --> D((User Authentication)) D -- Grant access --> B B -- Redirect to Callback
URL with Authorization Code --> A A -- Exchange Authorization Code
for Access Token --> B B -- Access Token --> A A -- Send Request with Access Token --> E((Resource Server)) E -- Validate Access Token --> B B -- Access Token Validation
Result --> E E -- Respond with Resource --> A

flowchart LR
    subgraph Client
        A((Start))
        A --> B(Redirect to Authorization Endpoint)
    end

    subgraph AuthorizationServer
        B --> C(Authenticate User)
        C --> D(Grant Access)
    end

    subgraph User
        D --> E(Generate Authorization Code)
        E --> F(Redirect to Callback URL)
    end

    subgraph Client
        F --> G(Exchange Authorization Code for Access Token)
        G --> H(Send Request with Access Token)
    end

    subgraph ResourceServer
        H --> I(Validate Access Token)
        I --> J{Access Token Valid?}
        J -- Yes --> K(Respond with Resource)
        J -- No --> L(Respond with Error)
    end

---
- name: Run 'cat /etc/passwd' and save output to a file for all hosts
  hosts: host_servers
  gather_facts: no

  tasks:
    - name: Get the contents of /etc/passwd
      shell: cat /etc/passwd
      register: passwd_output
      # You can also use the command module if you don't need shell features:
      # command: cat /etc/passwd

    - name: Save output to a file
      copy:
        dest: "/tmp/{{ inventory_hostname }}_etc_passwd.txt"
        content: "{{ passwd_output.stdout }}"
      delegate_to: localhost
      run_once: true

---
- name: Collect data and save to CSV
  hosts: host_servers
  gather_facts: no

  tasks:
    - name: Get hostname
      shell: hostname
      register: hostname_output

    - name: Get date and time
      shell: date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'
      register: datetime_output

    - name: Save data to a CSV file
      lineinfile:
        path: "/tmp/inventory_data.csv"
        line: "{{ hostname_output.stdout }},{{ datetime_output.stdout }}"
      delegate_to: localhost
      run_once: true

- name: Ensure the /passwd_files directory exists
  file:
    path: /passwd_files
    state: directory
  delegate_to: localhost

---
- name: Run 'cat /etc/passwd' and save output to a file for all hosts
  hosts: host_servers
  gather_facts: no

  tasks:
    - name: Ensure the /passwd_files directory exists
      file:
        path: /passwd_files
        state: directory
      delegate_to: localhost

    - name: Get the contents of /etc/passwd
      shell: cat /etc/passwd
      register: passwd_output

    - name: Save output to a file
      copy:
        dest: "/passwd_files/{{ inventory_hostname }}_etc_passwd.txt"
        content: "{{ passwd_output.stdout }}"
      delegate_to: localhost

---
- name: Collect /etc/passwd and save locally
  hosts: host_servers
  gather_facts: no

  vars:
    local_output_folder: "{{ playbook_dir }}/output_passwds"

  tasks:
    - name: Create a directory for output on the control machine
      ansible.builtin.file:
        path: "{{ local_output_folder }}"
        state: directory
      delegate_to: localhost
      run_once: true

    - name: Get the contents of /etc/passwd
      ansible.builtin.shell:
        cmd: cat /etc/passwd
      register: passwd_output

    - name: Save output to a local file
      ansible.builtin.copy:
        dest: "{{ local_output_folder }}/{{ inventory_hostname }}_etc_passwd.txt"
        content: "{{ passwd_output.stdout }}"
      delegate_to: localhost

Start ->
    Define the task at hand
        - Is it a question?
        - Is it a problem that requires a solution?

Gather necessary information about the task
    - What is the subject matter?
    - What are the key details that need to be included?
    - What is the desired outcome or type of response?

Determine the complexity of the task
    - Simple factual query?
    - Complex problem-solving?

Identify the audience or the expected knowledge level of the AI
    - General knowledge?
    - Expert level?

Decide on the style of the response
    - Formal or informal?
    - Detailed explanation or concise answer?

Construct the initial version of the prompt
    - Begin with a clear and direct question or statement.
    - Include all relevant details.
    - Be specific about what you are asking or the problem you need solved.

Review the prompt
    - Is it clear and unambiguous?
    - Does it include all necessary information without being overly detailed or verbose?

Revise if necessary
    - Modify the prompt to clarify any ambiguous areas.
    - Remove any unnecessary details that may confuse the AI.

Finalize the prompt
    - Ensure the final prompt is coherent and to the point.
    - Confirm that it sets clear expectations for the type of response.

Test the prompt (Optional)
    - Use the prompt with the AI and evaluate the response.
    - Is the response accurate and adequate?
    - Does the AI seem to understand the prompt correctly?

Iterate based on feedback
    - If the response is not what you expected, refine the prompt.
    - Incorporate any new insights or information that could improve the prompt.

End -> Use the refined prompt to get your answer or solution.

Start ->
    Define the task at hand
        - Question or Problem?

Gather necessary information about the task
    - Subject matter?
    - Key details and desired outcome?

Determine the complexity of the task
    - Simple factual query?
    - Complex problem-solving?
    - Single or multi-step process?
    - Need to interface with external tools or databases?

Evaluate AI requirements
    - Can a single LLM handle the task?
        --> YES: Continue to determine prompt structure
        --> NO: Determine the optimal configuration of AI assistants and tools

If a single LLM is sufficient:
    Construct the prompt
    - Direct and clear instructions
    - Include all necessary details
    - Specify style and knowledge expectation
    Review and revise the prompt as required
    - Clarity, coherence, and conciseness
    - Test the prompt (optional) and refine based on feedback
    Finalize and use the prompt

If an autonomous agent framework is required:
    Identify the roles for AI assistants
    - Information retrieval (e.g., web scraping, database querying)
    - Computation (e.g., calculations, data analysis)
    - Synthesis and reporting (e.g., summarizing findings, visualizing data)
    Determine the sequence of operations
    - Which task should be done first?
    - How will the output of one task feed into the next?
    Create structured prompts or commands for each agent
    - Be specific to each agent's role and capabilities
    - Ensure prompts are designed to facilitate inter-agent communication and data integration
    Review and orchestrate the workflow
    - Ensure tasks are assigned correctly and effectively
    - Test the workflow (optional) with a small-scale dry run
    - Iterate and refine workflow and prompts based on performance
    Implement and monitor the agents' work
    - Ensure results are being combined effectively for the final output

End -> Collect, synthesize, and present the results.

Start ->
    Define the task at hand
        - Question or Problem?

Gather necessary information about the task
    - Subject matter?
    - Key details and desired outcome?

Determine the complexity of the task
    - Simple factual query?
    - Complex problem-solving?
    - Single or multi-step process?

Evaluate AI requirements
    - Can a single LLM handle the task using standard prompting?
        --> YES: Choose standard prompting techniques
        --> NO: Proceed to evaluate advanced prompting techniques

If advanced prompting techniques are advisable:
    Choose an advanced prompting technique
    - Tree of Thoughts (ToT)
    - Chain of thought
    - Recursive prompting
    - Other advanced methods suitable for the task

Construct the advanced prompt
    - Define the structure of the prompt based on the selected technique
    - Include problem breakdown, intermediate steps, and reasoning checkpoints
    Review and revise the prompt for clarity and effectiveness
    Test the prompt (optional) and iterate based on feedback
    Finalize and use the advanced prompt

If standard prompting is sufficient:
    Construct the standard prompt
    - Direct and clear instructions
    - Include all necessary details
    Review, refine, and finalize the standard prompt
    Test the prompt (optional) and iterate based on feedback
    Implement the final prompt

End -> Obtain and evaluate the response.

Start ->
    Pre-assess AI tools and resources
        -> What AI capabilities are available?
        -> What are the data privacy and sensitivity considerations?

Define the task at hand
    -> Question or Problem?
    -> Complexity, sensitivity, and required resources?

Gather necessary information about the task
    -> Subject matter?
    -> Desired outcome and specifics?

Evaluate AI requirements and select approach
    -> Can a single LLM handle the task?
    -> Is an advanced prompting technique or autonomous agent framework needed?
    -> What are the concurrency and scalability considerations?

Select and construct prompts
    -> For single LLM or multiple AI agents/advanced techniques
    -> Incorporate structure based on approach

Review, revise, and document the prompt
    -> Clarity, effectiveness, and compliance

Implement and test the prompt
    -> Test and obtain AI's response
    -> Establish feedback loops for refinement

Verify results and conduct an iterative refinement
    -> Check results against standards or expert knowledge
    -> Refine prompts and process based on feedback

Document outcomes and lessons learned
    -> Create a knowledge base for future tasks

Evaluate scalability and define an exit strategy
    -> Assess if the approach is effective for broader applications
    -> Determine conditions to abort if necessary

End -> Finalize and use the results.

kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  name: port-forward-ds
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: port-forward
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: port-forward
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: port-forward-container
          image: busybox
          command: ['sh', '-c', 'trap "exit 0;" TERM INT; while :; do sleep 86400; done']
          ports:
            - containerPort: 8080 # Port you want to forward

@startuml
actor Employee as emp
participant "Local HR Manager" as localHR
participant "Other HR Managers" as otherHRs

' 匹配申请人技能和工作经验及安排面试
emp -> localHR: Submit Application
localHR -> localHR: Review Skills and Experience
localHR -> emp: Schedule Interview

' 面试及发放 offer
emp -> localHR: Attend Interview
localHR -> localHR: Evaluate Interview
localHR -> emp: Send Offer

' 接受或拒绝 offer
emp -> emp: Decide(accept/reject)
emp -> localHR: Send Response

' 如果接受，发起调职申请
alt if accepted
    emp -> localHR: Accept Offer
    localHR -> otherHRs: Send Transfer Request
else rejected
    emp -> localHR: Reject Offer
end

' Complete the diagram
localHR -> otherHRs: Issue Transfer(if accepted)
otherHRs -> emp: Notify Transfer Completion(if accepted)
@enduml

multiHeal :: Health -> Army -> Army
multiHeal amount army = applyHeal army (distributeHeal amount aliveCount) 0
  where
    -- Select Alive units
    aliveUnits = filter isAlive army
    aliveCount = length aliveUnits

    -- Check if a unit is alive
    isAlive (E (Alive _)) = True
    isAlive (M (Alive _)) = True
    isAlive _             = False

    -- Distribute the healing evenly, and store leftovers
    distributeHeal total cnt = let (q,r) = total `divMod` cnt in replicate cnt q ++ replicate r 1

    -- Apply the healing to each unit, skipping Dead units
    applyHeal :: Army -> [Health] -> Int -> Army
    applyHeal [] _ _ = []
    applyHeal (u:us) (h:hs) n
        | isAlive u = healUnit u h : applyHeal us hs (n + 1)
        | otherwise = u : applyHeal us (h:hs) n  -- Keep the healing amount for the next alive unit
    applyHeal (u:us) [] n = u : applyHeal us [] n  -- No more healing, just copy the rest of the units

    -- Healing a single unit
    healUnit (E (Alive (Golem health))) h = E (Alive (Golem (health + h)))
    healUnit (M (Alive (Master name health spell))) h = M (Alive (Master name (health + h) spell))
    healUnit u _ = u -- No operation if the unit is Dead or the list of healing amounts is empty

---
- name: Manage WebLogic Domain
  hosts: host_servers
  become: yes
  become_user: oracle
  gather_facts: true
  vars:
    weblogic_home: "/u01/oracle/middleware"
    scripts_home: "/home/oracle/scripts"
    wlst: "{{ weblogic_home }}/oracle_common/common/bin/wlst.sh"
    admin_server_script: "user_projects/domains/{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].domain }}/bin/startWebLogic.sh"
    node_manager_script: "user_projects/domains/{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].domain }}/bin/startNodeManager.sh"

  tasks:
    - name: Ensure scripts directory exists or create
      file:
        path: "{{ scripts_home }}"
        state: directory
      tags: [always]

    - name: Copy Python scripts to target server
      copy:
        src: "{{ item }}"
        dest: "{{ scripts_home }}/{{ item | basename }}"
        mode: 0755
      with_fileglob:
        - /home/osboxes/ossdy-project/scripts/*.py
      tags: [always]

    # Stop sequence with tags
    - name: Stop Managed Server
      shell: "{{ wlst }} -i {{ scripts_home }}/stop_managed_servers.py {{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_username }} {{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_password }} t3://{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_host }}:{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_port }} {{ force_stop }}"
      ignore_errors: true
      tags: stop

    - debug:
        var: result_stop_all.stdout_lines
      tags: stop

    # ... (You can put the rest of your stop sequence here with tags: stop)

    # Start sequence with tags
    - name: Ensure Node Manager port is available
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].node_manager_port }}"
        state: started
        timeout: 800
      tags: [start, check_ports]

    - name: Start Node Manager
      shell: "{{ weblogic_home }}/{{ node_manager_script }} &"
      when: node_manager_port|string not in check_nm_port.stdout
      tags: start

    - name: Ensure Admin port is available
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_port }}"
        state: started
        timeout: 800
      tags: [start, check_ports]

    - name: Start Admin Server
      shell: "{{ weblogic_home }}/{{ admin_server_script }} &"
      when: admin_port|string not in check_wl_port.stdout
      tags: start

    # ... (You can put the rest of your start sequence here with tags: start)

    - name: Start Managed Server
      shell: "{{ wlst }} -i {{ scripts_home }}/start_managed_servers.py {{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_username }} {{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_password }} t3://{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].ansible_host }}:{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_port }}"
      when: admin_port|string in check_wl_port.stdout
      tags: start

    - debug:
        var: result_start_all.stdout_lines
      tags: start

    - name: Delete scripts directory from target server
      file:
        path: "{{ scripts_home }}"
        state: absent
      tags: cleanup

---
- name: Manage WebLogic Domain
  hosts: host_servers
  become: yes
  become_user: oracle
  gather_facts: true
  vars:
    weblogic_home: "/u01/oracle/middleware"
    domain_home: "{{ weblogic_home }}/user_projects/domains/{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].domain }}"
    scripts_home: "/home/oracle/scripts"
    wlst: "{{ weblogic_home }}/oracle_common/common/bin/wlst.sh"

  tasks:
    - name: Ensure scripts directory exists
      file:
        path: "{{ scripts_home }}"
        state: directory
      tags: [always]

    - name: Copy Python scripts to target server
      copy:
        src: "{{ item }}"
        dest: "{{ scripts_home }}/{{ item | basename }}"
        mode: 0755
      with_fileglob:
        - "/path/on/control/machine/to/scripts/*.py"
      tags: [always]

    - name: Pre-check for Admin Server port closure
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_port }}"
        state: stopped
        timeout: 30
      register: admin_port_check
      ignore_errors: true
      tags: [pre_check]

    - name: Start Admin Server if port is closed
      shell: "nohup {{ domain_home }}/bin/startWebLogic.sh > /dev/null 2>&1 &"
      when: admin_port_check is failed
      tags: [start]

    - name: Wait for Admin Server to be up
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_port }}"
        state: started
        timeout: 600
      when: admin_port_check is failed
      tags: [start_wait]

    - name: Start Managed Servers with WLST
      shell: "{{ wlst }} -i {{ scripts_home }}/start_managed_servers.py"
      when: admin_port_check is failed
      tags: [start]

    - name: Pre-check for Node Manager port closure
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].node_manager_port }}"
        state: stopped
        timeout: 30
      register: nm_port_check
      ignore_errors: true
      tags: stop

    - name: Stop Managed Servers with WLST
      shell: "{{ wlst }} -i {{ scripts_home }}/stop_managed_servers.py"
      tags: [stop]

    - name: Stop Admin Server
      shell: "nohup {{ domain_home }}/bin/stopWebLogic.sh > /dev/null 2>&1 &"
      tags: [stop]

    - name: Wait for Admin Server port closure
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_port }}"
        state: stopped
        timeout: 600
      tags: [stop_wait]

    - name: Stop Node Manager if port is opened
      shell: "nohup {{ domain_home }}/bin/stopNodeManager.sh > /dev/null 2>&1 &"
      when: nm_port_check is succeeded
      tags: [stop]

    - name: Wait for Node Manager port closure
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].node_manager_port }}"
        state: stopped
        timeout: 600
      when: nm_port_check is succeeded
      tags: [stop_wait]

    - name: Delete scripts directory from target server
      file:
        path: "{{ scripts_home }}"
        state: absent
      tags: cleanup

    domain_home: "{{ weblogic_home }}/user_projects/domains/{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].domain }}"
    scripts_home: "/home/oracle/scripts"
    wlst: "{{ weblogic_home }}/oracle_common/common/bin/wlst.sh"

  tasks:
    - name: Ensure scripts directory exists
      file:
        path: "{{ scripts_home }}"
        state: directory
      tags:
        - always

    - name: Copy Python scripts to target server
      copy:
        src: "{{ item }}"
        dest: "{{ scripts_home }}/{{ item | basename }}"
        mode: 0755
      with_fileglob:
        - "/path/on/control/machine/to/scripts/*.py"
      tags:
        - always

    # Start sequence with tag 'start'
    - name: Check if Node Manager port is open
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].node_manager_port }}"
        state: started
        timeout: 30
      register: nm_port_status
      tags:
        - pre_start_check

    - name: Start Node Manager if needed
      shell: "nohup {{ domain_home }}/bin/startNodeManager.sh > /dev/null 2>&1 &"
      when: nm_port_status is failed
      tags:
        - start

    - name: Check if Admin Server port is open
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_port }}"
        state: started
        timeout: 30
      register: admin_port_status
      tags:
        - pre_start_check

    - name: Start Admin Server if needed
      shell: "nohup {{ domain_home }}/bin/startWebLogic.sh > /dev/null 2>&1 &"
      when: admin_port_status is failed
      tags:
        - start

    - name: Wait for Admin Server to start
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_port }}"
        state: started
        timeout: 600
      when: admin_port_status is failed
      tags:
        - start_wait

    - name: Start Managed Servers with WLST
      shell: "{{ wlst }} '{{ scripts_home }}/start_managed_servers.py'"
      when: admin_port_status is failed
      tags:
        - start

    # Stop sequence with tag 'stop'
    - name: Check if Admin Server port is open (before stop)
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_port }}"
        state: started
        timeout: 30
      register: admin_port_stop_status
      ignore_errors: yes
      tags:
        - pre_stop_check

    - name: Stop Managed Servers with WLST
      shell: "{{ wlst }} '{{ scripts_home }}/stop_managed_servers.py'"
      when: admin_port_stop_status is succeeded
      tags:
        - stop

    - name: Stop Admin Server
      shell: "nohup {{ domain_home }}/bin/stopWebLogic.sh > /dev/null 2>&1 &"
      when: admin_port_stop_status is succeeded
      tags:
        - stop

    - name: Wait for Admin Server to stop
      wait_for:
        host: "{{ ansible_host }}"
        port: "{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname].admin_port }}"
        state: stopped
        timeout: 600
      when: admin_port_stop_status is succeeded
      tags:
        - stop_wait

    - name: Delete scripts directory from target server
      file:
        path: "{{ scripts_home }}"
        state: absent
      tags:
        - cleanup

isPrime :: Int -> Bool
isPrime num
    | num < 2 = False
    | otherwise = all (\x -> num `mod` x /= 0) [2..(floor $ sqrt $ fromIntegral num)]

countPrimes :: [Int] -> Int
countPrimes = length . filter isPrime

main :: IO ()
main = do
    putStrLn "Enter a sequence of numbers:"
    numbers <- getContents
    let numList = map read $ words numbers :: [Int]
    let primeCount = countPrimes numList
    putStrLn $ "Number of prime numbers: " ++ show primeCount

isPrime :: Int -> Bool
isPrime n
    | n <= 1 = False
    | otherwise = not $ any (\x -> n `mod` x == 0) [2..sqrtInt n]
    where
        sqrtInt = floor . sqrt . fromIntegral

isPrime :: Integer -> Bool
isPrime n
    | n <= 1 = False
    | n <= 3 = True
    | n `mod` 2 == 0 || n `mod` 3 == 0 = False
    | otherwise = checkDivisors n 5
    where
        checkDivisors num divisor
            | divisor * divisor > num = True
            | num `mod` divisor == 0 || num `mod` (divisor + 2) == 0 = False
            | otherwise = checkDivisors num (divisor + 6)

countPrimes :: Int -> Int
countPrimes limit = length $ filter isPrime [2..limit]

isPrime :: Int -> Bool
isPrime n
    | n <= 1 = False
    | otherwise = not $ any (\x -> n `mod` x == 0) [2..sqrtInt n]
    where
        sqrtInt = floor . sqrt . fromIntegral

zero :: Contract
one :: Currency -> Contract

or :: Contract -> Contract -> Contract
at :: Date -> Contract -> Contract

-- Conditional operators
when :: Event -> Contract -> Contract
unless :: Event -> Contract -> Contract

Cinccino (Small monstrosity, neutral)
---------------------------------------------

Armor Class: 15 (natural armor)
Hit Points: 36 (8d6 + 8)
Speed: 40 ft., climb 30 ft.

STR | DEX | CON | INT | WIS | CHA
--- | --- | --- | --- | --- | ---
8   | 18  | 15  | 7   | 14  | 12

Skills: Acrobatics +6, Perception +5
Senses: passive Perception 15
Languages: understands Common but can't speak
Challenge: 2 (450 XP)

Abilities:
------------

Keen Smell: Cinccino has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Neat Freak: If an opponent is heavily soiled, Cinccino gets advantage on its next attack against that opponent due to its focus on cleaning the target. If Cinccino spends a turn cleaning an ally or a space within 5 ft., the ally gains advantage on its next attack roll, or the space is considered cleansed of bigger contaminants up to a foot in diameter.

Tail Slap (Multiattack): Cinccino makes three melee attacks with its fluffy tail, laced with a sleek sheen. Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target, Hit: 6 (1d6+3) bludgeoning damage per slap.

Bullet Seed: Cinccino ejects seeds at a rapid pace towards a target. Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 40 ft., one target, Hit: 14 (4d4+4) piercing damage.

Rock Blast: As an action, Cinccino hurls small rocks in rapid succession at one to three creatures it can see within 50 feet of it. Make a separate attack for each rock. Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 50 ft., one target per rock, Hit: 8 (1d8+4) bludgeoning damage.

Evasion: If Cinccino is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Cinccino takes no damage if it succeeds on the save, and only half damage if it fails.

Actions:
---------

Skill Link (Recharge 5-6): Cinccino links its attacks with impeccable skill, ensuring a flurry of hits. For its next turn, each attack roll against a target that would normally hit becomes a critical hit.

Reactions:
-----------

Refined Escape: When a creature misses Cinccino with a melee attack, Cinccino can move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

- name: Simplified Check Node Manager Port for each unique IP
  debug:
    msg: "Testing with IP: {{ item.key }} and Port: {{ item.value }}"
  loop: "{{ ip_to_nm_port | dict2items }}"
  when: 
    - matching_hosts is defined
    - item.key in matching_hosts and matching_hosts[item.key] | length > 0
  tags: [always]

- name: Check Node Manager Port for each unique IP
  shell: 'netstat -an | grep ":{{ item.value }} " | grep LISTEN'
  delegate_to: "{{ item.key }}"
  loop: "{{ ip_to_nm_port | dict2items }}"
  vars:
    ansible_ssh_pass: "{{ hostvars[matching_hosts[item.key][0]].ansible_ssh_pass }}"
  when: 
    - matching_hosts is defined
    - item.key in matching_hosts and matching_hosts[item.key] | length > 0
  register: nm_port_checks
  tags: [always]

  vars_files:

# Assume the DataFrame aliases are set up correctly
# v5pf = ...
# eod_vw = ...
# v5pf_d4pf_temp_tbl = v5pf_d4pf_temp_tbl.alias("d4")  # Example of aliasing
# v5pf_d5pf_temp_tbl = v5pf_d5pf_temp_tbl.alias("d5")  # Example of aliasing
# otpf = otpf.alias("ot")  # Example of aliasing

# Now apply the UDF to the correct column
fourth_union = (
    v5pf.join(eod_vw, v5pf["eod_date"] == eod_vw["eod_date"])
    .join(v5pf_d4pf_temp_tbl, (
        v5pf["v5brnm"] == v5pf_d4pf_temp_tbl["v5brnm"]) &
        (v5pf["v5dlp"] == v5pf_d4pf_temp_tbl["v5dlp"]) & 
        (v5pf["v5dlr"] == v5pf_d4pf_temp_tbl["v5dlr"]), "left_outer"
    )
    .join(v5pf_d5pf_temp_tbl, (
        v5pf["v5brnm"] == v5pf_d5pf_temp_tbl["v5brnm"]) &
        (v5pf["v5dlp"] == v5pf_d5pf_temp_tbl["v5dlp"]) & 
        (v5pf["v5dlr"] == v5pf_d5pf_temp_tbl["v5dlr"]), "left_outer"
    )
    .withColumn("eff_date", format_otsdte_udf(v5pf_d4pf_temp_tbl["otsdte"]))  # Using alias here
    .filter((v5pf["v5peg"] == "Y") & (v5pf["v5rat"] == 0))
    .select(
        v5pf["v5brnm"], v5pf["v5dlp"], v5pf["v5dlr"],
        when(v5pf["v5tdt"] == "L", 
             coalesce(col("d4brar"), lit(0)) + coalesce(col("d5drar"), lit(0)) + coalesce(col("v5rtm"), lit(0))
        ).when(v5pf["v5tdt"] == "D", 
               coalesce(col("d4brar"), lit(0)) - coalesce(col("d5drar"), lit(0)) - coalesce(col("v5rtm"), lit(0))
        ).alias("effective_rate"),
        "eff_date"
    )
)

Investor -> SolverVault: Calls deposit(amount)
SolverVault -> ERC20(collateralToken): Calls safeTransferFrom(investor, SolverVault, amount)
ERC20 -> SolverVault: Transfers amount
SolverVault -> SolverVaultToken: Calls mint(investor, amountInSolverVaultTokenDecimals)
SolverVaultToken -> SolverVaultToken: Executes _mint(investor, amountInSolverVaultTokenDecimals)
SolverVaultToken -> Investor: Credits investor's account with SolverVaultToken

trigger:

resources:
- repo: self

pool:
  vmImage: 'ubuntu-latest'

variables:
  imageName: 'your-image-name:$(Build.BuildId)'
  containerRegistry: 'yourContainerRegistry.azurecr.io'

stages:
- stage: Build
  jobs:
  - job: Build
    displayName: Build and push Docker image
    steps:
      - task: Docker@2
        displayName: Build Docker image
        inputs:
          command: build
          dockerfile: $(Build.SourcesDirectory)/Dockerfile
          tags: |
            $(imageName)

      - task: Docker@2
        displayName: Push Docker image
        inputs:
          command: push
          repository: $(containerRegistry)/$(imageName)
          tags: |
            $(imageName)

- stage: Deploy
  # Add a deployment job or other tasks based on your requirements
  # This part of the YAML file will depend on how you deploy your app
  # For example, you can deploy to Azure Web App for Containers, AKS, etc.

trigger:
- main

resources:
- repo: self

variables:
  tag: '$(Build.BuildId)'
  imageName: 'your-app-name'
  containerRegistry: 'yourContainerRegistry.azurecr.io'
  containerRegistryUsername: '$(DOCKER_REGISTRY_USERNAME)'
  containerRegistryPassword: '$(DOCKER_REGISTRY_PASSWORD)'

stages:
- stage: Build
  displayName: Build image
  jobs:
  - job: Build
    displayName: Build
    pool:
      vmImage: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - task: Docker@2
      displayName: Build an image
      inputs:
        command: build
        dockerfile: '$(Build.SourcesDirectory)/Dockerfile'
        tags: |
          $(imageName):$(tag)
    - task: Docker@2
      displayName: Log in to ACR
      inputs:
        command: login
        containerRegistry: $(containerRegistry)
        username: $(containerRegistryUsername)
        password: $(containerRegistryPassword)
    - task: Docker@2
      displayName: Push an image to ACR
      inputs:
        command: push
        repository: $(containerRegistry)/$(imageName)
        tags: |
          $(tag)
          latest

# Add more stages for deployment depending on your requirements
# If deploying to Azure App Service, you can include a stage like the following:

- stage: Deploy
  displayName: Deploy to Azure App Service
  condition: succeeded()
  jobs:
  - deployment: Deploy
    displayName: Deploy
    environment: 'YourDeploymentEnvironment'
    pool:
      vmImage: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      runOnce:
        deploy:
          steps:
          - task: AzureWebApp@1
            displayName: Deploy to Azure Web App
            inputs:
              azureSubscription: '<AzureServiceConnection>'
              appType: 'webAppLinux'
              appName: '<YourAppName>'
              runtimeStack: 'PYTHON|3.11'
              startUpCommand: 'gunicorn -b :$PORT app:app'
              images: '$(containerRegistry)/$(imageName):$(tag)'

fac1 :: (Integral a) => a -> a
fac1 n = product [1..n]

fac2 :: (Integral a) => a -> a
fac2 0 = 1
fac2 n = n * fac2 (n - 1)

main :: IO ()
main = do
  putStrLn "Введите число для вычисления факториала: "
  input <- getLine
  case reads input :: [(Integer, String)] of
    [(n, "")] -> do
      let xs = fac1 n
      let xy = fac2 n
      putStrLn $ "Вычисленный факториал 1 = " ++ show xs
      putStrLn $ "Вычисленный факториал 2 = " ++ show xy
    _ -> putStrLn "Ошибка: введено некорректное число."

---
- name: Install NFS Server on Debian 12
  hosts: nfs_servers
  become: yes
  vars:
    nfs_export_dir: /srv/nfs
    nfs_network: 192.168.1.0/24
    nfs_writeable: "yes"
    nfs_async: "yes"

  tasks:
    - name: Update apt cache
      apt:
        update_cache: yes
        cache_valid_time: 3600 # In seconds

    - name: Install NFS kernel server and related packages
      apt:
        name:
          - nfs-kernel-server
          - nfs-common
          - rpcbind
        state: present

    - name: Ensure NFS directories exist
      file:
        path: "{{ nfs_export_dir }}"
        state: directory
        owner: nobody
        group: nogroup

    - name: Add NFS exports entries
      blockinfile:
        path: /etc/exports
        block: |
          {{ nfs_export_dir }} {{ nfs_network }}(rw,sync,no_root_squash,no_subtree_check)
        state: present
        create: yes
        backup: yes

    - name: Restart NFS services to apply changes
      systemd:
        name: "{{ item }}"
        state: restarted
        enabled: yes
      loop:
        - rpcbind
        - nfs-server

version: '3.7'

services:
  minio:
    image: minio/minio
    volumes:
      - minio_data:/data
    ports:
      - "9000:9000" # 默认端口，如果需要的话可以修改
    environment:
      MINIO_ACCESS_KEY: youraccesskey # 替换为您的Access Key
      MINIO_SECRET_KEY: yoursecretkey # 替换为您的Secret Key
    command: server /data
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "curl", "-f", "http://localhost:9000/minio/health/live"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 20s
      retries: 3

volumes:
  minio_data:

    command: server /data

volumes:

  url: http://localhost:9000

Feature: User management

  Scenario: Create a new user
    Given the user does not exist
    When I create the user with name "John Doe" and email "john.doe@example.com"
    Then the user with email "john.doe@example.com" should be added to the database

  Scenario: Delete a user
    Given the user with email "john.doe@example.com" exists
    When I delete the user with email "john.doe@example.com"
    Then the user with email "john.doe@example.com" should be removed from the database

Feature: End to End Webdriver Scenario

Scenario: End to End process of creating, logging in, viewing, and deleting a webdriver session
  Given the webdriver service for session management is up
  # Create Session
  When a user initiates a create session request with desired capabilities
  Then the system should create a new session and return a session ID
  And the system should respond with a status code 200 and session details

  # Login
  Given the user has a valid session ID
  When the user sends a login request to the webdriver with correct credentials
  Then the system should log the user into the session
  And the system should respond with a status code 200 confirming user login

  # View Session
  Given the user is logged into the session
  When the user requests to view session information
  Then the system should retrieve the session information
  And the system should respond with a status code 200 and session information
  
  # Delete Session  
  Given the user has finished their tasks in the session
  When the user sends a request to delete the session
  Then the system should close the session and free resources
  And the system should respond with a status code 200 confirming session deletion

Log Data:
- API Call: POST /session {"desiredCapabilities": {...}}
- Response: 200 {"sessionId": "session123", "value": {...}}
- Context Data: {"session_id": "session123"}

- API Call: POST /session/session123/login {"username": "user", "password": "pass"}
- Response: 200 {"value": "User logged in"}
- Context Data: {"session_id": "session123", "user_logged_in": true}

- API Call: GET /session/session123
- Response: 200 {"value": {...}}
- Context Data: {"session_id": "session123", "session_info": {...}}

- API Call: DELETE /session/session123
- Response: 200 {"value": "Session deleted"}
- Context Data: {"session_id": "session123", "session_status": "deleted"}

2 // sum = 0 + moving_Forward[0] + moving_backwards[2] -> sum = 0 + 0 + 2
1 // sum = 0 + moving_Forward[0] + moving_backwards[1] -> sum = 0 + 0 + 1
0 // sum = 0 + moving_Forward[0] + moving_backwards[0] -> sum = 0 + 0 + 0
3 // sum = 0 + moving_Forward[1] + moving_backwards[2] -> sum = 0 + 1 + 2
2 // sum = 0 + moving_Forward[1] + moving_backwards[1] -> sum = 0 + 1 + 1
1 // sum = 0 + moving_Forward[1] + moving_backwards[0] -> sum = 0 + 1 + 0
4 // sum = 0 + moving_Forward[2] + moving_backwards[2] -> sum = 0 + 2 + 2
3 // sum = 0 + moving_Forward[2] + moving_backwards[1] -> sum = 0 + 2 + 1
2 // sum = 0 + moving_Forward[2] + moving_backwards[0] -> sum = 0 + 2 + 0

version: '3'
services:
  redis:
    image: 'redis:alpine'
    ports:
      - '6379:6379'

  app:
    build: .
    depends_on:
      - redis
    ports:
      - '8080:3000' # Map your Docker host port to the container port
    environment:
      - REDIS_HOST=redis
      - REDIS_PORT=6379
    restart: unless-stopped

version: '3.8'

services:
  app:
    build: .
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"  # Expose the app on port 3000
    environment:     # Set your environment variables if any
      - NODE_ENV=production
      # Define other environment variables here
    depends_on:
      - kafka
      - db
    volumes:
      - ./logs:/app/logs   # Bind mount the logs directory

  db:
    image: "mysql:5.7"     # Use the image that suits your SQL database requirements
    environment:
      MYSQL_DATABASE: 'medicsdb'  # Replace with your db name
      MYSQL_USER: 'user'  # Replace with your db user
      MYSQL_PASSWORD: 'password'  # Replace with your db password
      MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: 'password'  # Replace with your db root password
    volumes:
      - db-data:/var/lib/mysql

  kafka:
    image: "confluentinc/cp-kafka:latest"  # Use Kafka image from Confluent
    environment:
      KAFKA_BROKER_ID: 1
      KAFKA_ZOOKEEPER_CONNECT: zookeeper:2181
      KAFKA_ADVERTISED_LISTENERS: PLAINTEXT://kafka:9092
      KAFKA_OFFSETS_TOPIC_REPLICATION_FACTOR: 1
    depends_on:
      - zookeeper

  zookeeper:
    image: "confluentinc/cp-zookeeper:latest"
    environment:
      ZOOKEEPER_CLIENT_PORT: 2181
      ZOOKEEPER_TICK_TIME: 2000

volumes:
  db-data:  # Named volume to keep db data persistent

(defn fetch-data
  "Generic request for data. Applies the hardcoded API token."
  [url & [params]]
  (let [params-map (if params (into {} (map (fn [[k v]] [k (str v)]) params)) {})]
    (future (-> (client/get
                 url
                 {:as :json
                  :query-params (merge {:api_token @api-key} params-map)})
                (:body)))))

% Определение класса города
class city(
  name: string,
  connections: list[connection]
).

% Определение класса дороги
class connection(
  destination: city,
  distance: float
).

implement main
open core

clauses
run() :-
  % Создаем города
  CityA = new city("a", []),
  CityB = new city("b", []),
  CityC = new city("c", []),
  CityD = new city("d", []),
  CityE  = new city("e", []),
  CityF  = new city("f", []),
  CityG  = new city("g", []),

  % Создаем дороги между городами и указываем их протяженность
  addConnection(CityA, CityB, 10.0),
  addConnection(CityA, CityE, 1.0),
  addConnection(CityA, CityD, 4.0),
  addConnection(CityC, CityB, 1.0),
  addConnection(CityC, CityE, 2.0),
  addConnection(CityC, CityD, 1.0),
  addConnection(CityF, CityB, 15.0),
  addConnection(CityF, CityD, 7.0),
  addConnection(CityF, CityG, 6.0),
  addConnection(CityG, CityD, 5.0),
  addConnection(CityE, CityB, 3.0),
  addConnection(CityE, CityD, 3.0),

  % Проверяем, что города и дороги созданы успешно
  foreach(
      City in [CityA, CityB, CityC, CityD, CityE, CityF, CityG],
      writeln("Город: ", City?name),
      foreach(Conn in City?connections, writeln("  Дорога в ", Conn?destination?name, " с протяженностью ", Conn?distance))
  ).

% Добавление дороги между городами
addConnection(City1: city, City2: city, Distance: float) :-
  Connection = new connection(City2, Distance),
  City1?connections := [Connection | City1?connections],
  Connection2 = new connection(City1, Distance),
  City2?connections := [Connection2 | City2?connections].
  
end implement main

% Запуск программы
goal
console::runUtf8(main::run).

mother(X, Y) :- female(X), parent(X, Y).

% Правило о том, что человек “X” является родителем человека “Y”
parent(anna, petr).

% Запрос для нахождения матери “Петра”
?- mother(X, petr).

class main: platform::Application
    predicates
        run : window::mainWindow.
    clauses
        run(MainWindow) :-
            new(MainWindow, window::mainWindow),
            MainWindow:showWindow().

% Определение квалификации по набранным баллам
qualification(Z, 'Магистр') :- Z >= 80, Z =< 100.
qualification(Z, 'Специалист') :- Z >= 60, Z < 80.
qualification(Z, 'Бакалавр') :- Z >= 40, Z < 60.
qualification(Z, 'Неудачник') :- Z >= 0, Z < 40.

% Процедура получения пользовательского ввода и определения квалификации
determine_qualification :-
    % Запрашиваем значение Z
    write('Введите количество баллов Z: '), read(Z),
    % Проверяем введенное значение и присваиваем квалификацию согласно правилам
    (qualification(Z, Qualification)
    % Выводим результат
    -> format('Студент получил квалификацию: ~w', [Qualification])
    ; format('Введено неправильное значение баллов Z: ~w', [Z])).

domains
    score = integer.
    qualification = string.

predicates
    classify(score, qualification).
    main.

clauses
    classify(Z, "M") :- Z >= 80, Z <= 100.
    classify(Z, "S") :- Z >= 60, Z < 80.
    classify(Z, "B") :- Z >= 40, Z < 60.
    classify(Z, "N") :- Z >= 0, Z < 40.

    main() :-
        write("Enter student's score (Z): "),
        readint(Z),
        (classify(Z, Qualification) ->
            writef("The student's qualification is %s\n", Qualification)
        ;
            write("Invalid score.\n")
        ).

goal
    main.

qualification(B, Z) :- Z >= 40, Z < 60, B = 'бакалавр'.
qualification(N, Z) :- Z >= 0, Z < 40, N = 'неудачник'.

main :-
    write('Введите количество баллов: '),
    read(Z),
    qualification(Qualification, Z),
    format('Квалификация: ~w', [Qualification]).

:- main.

apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolume
metadata:
  name: mysql-pv
  labels:
    type: local
spec:
  storageClassName: manual
  capacity:
    storage: 20Gi
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  hostPath:
    path: "/mnt/data/mysql"

apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
metadata:
  name: mysql-pv-claim
spec:
  storageClassName: manual
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  resources:
    requests:
      storage: 20Gi

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: mysql
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: wordpress
      tier: mysql
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: wordpress
        tier: mysql
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: mysql:5.7
        name: mysql
        env:
        - name: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              name: mysql-secret
              key: password
        - name: MYSQL_DATABASE
          value: wordpress
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3306
          name: mysql
        volumeMounts:
        - name: mysql-persistent-storage
          mountPath: /var/lib/mysql
      volumes:
      - name: mysql-persistent-storage
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: mysql-pv-claim

apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: mysql-secret
type: Opaque
data:
  password: YOUR_BASE64_ENCODED_PASSWORD

apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
metadata:
  name: wordpress-pv-claim
spec:
  storageClassName: manual
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  resources:
    requests:
      storage: 20Gi

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: wordpress
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: wordpress
      tier: frontend
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: wordpress
        tier: frontend
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: wordpress:latest
        name: wordpress
        env:
        - name: WORDPRESS_DB_HOST
          value: mysql
        - name: WORDPRESS_DB_PASSWORD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              name: mysql-secret
              key: password
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
          name: wordpress
        volumeMounts:
        - name: wordpress-persistent-storage
          mountPath: /var/www/html
      volumes:
      - name: wordpress-persistent-storage
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: wordpress-pv-claim

apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: mysql
spec:
  ports:
  - port: 3306
  selector:
    app: wordpress
    tier: mysql
  clusterIP: None

apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: wordpress
spec:
  ports:
  - port: 80
  selector:
    app: wordpress
    tier: frontend
  type: LoadBalancer

name: Run Python Script

on:
  schedule:
    # Runs every 5 minutes
    - cron: '*/5 * * * *'

jobs:
  run_script:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest  # يمكنك اختيار النظام الذي يناسبك

    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v2 # يقوم بتحميل الكود من مستودعك

      - name: Set up Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v2
        with:
          python-version: '3.x' # إصدار بايثون الذي تحتاجه

      - name: Install dependencies (إذا كان لديك اعتماديات)
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          if [ -f requirements.txt ]; then pip install -r requirements.txt; fi

      - name: Run script
        run: python your-script.py # قم بتغيير الاسم إلى اسم سكريبتك

networks:
  microgod-bot-network:

Start:
    1. Initialize the values of the variables (x_1, x_2, ..., x_n).
Repeat for each iteration:
    2. Sample x_1 from P(x_1 | x_2, ..., x_n).
    3. Sample x_2 from P(x_2 | x_1, x_3, ..., x_n).
    4. ...
    n. Sample x_n from P(x_n | x_1, x_2, ..., x_(n-1)).
End:
    - After a 'burn-in' period and every 'thin' iterations, record the samples.
    - Continue until sufficient samples are collected for the analysis.

Assume the following conditionals:

P(X|Y=y) ~ N(a + b*y, sigma_x^2)
P(Y|X=x) ~ N(c + d*x, sigma_y^2)

Where a, b, c, d, sigma_x^2, and sigma_y^2 are known values.

Follow the Gibbs Sampling steps:
1. Start with any initial value y^(0).
2. For each iteration k (where k = 1, 2, ...):
   a. Sample x^(k) from N(a + b*y^(k-1), sigma_x^2)
   b. Sample y^(k) from N(c + d*x^(k), sigma_y^2)
3. Continue until convergence.

<LinearLayout
    android:layout_width="match_parent" <!-- Este LinearLayout ocupa todo el ancho disponible de su contenedor. -->
    android:layout_height="wrap_content" <!-- La altura de LinearLayout solo es tan grande como el contenido que incluye. -->
    android:layout_margin="10dp" <!-- Un margen de 10dp es aplicado en todas las direcciones del LinearLayout. -->
    android:orientation="horizontal"> <!-- Los hijos de este LinearLayout se disponen en una fila horizontal. -->

    <com.google.android.material.card.MaterialCardView
        android:layout_width="0dp" <!-- El ancho del MaterialCardView es inicialmente 0, pero se inflará en base al layout_weight. -->
        android:layout_height="match_parent" <!-- El MaterialCardView tiene la misma altura que su contenedor. -->
        android:layout_marginEnd="20dp" <!-- Se aplica un margen al final (derecha en LTR) del MaterialCardView. -->
        android:layout_weight="1" <!-- Da un peso relativo de 1 en la distribución del espacio horizontal disponible. -->
        android:elevation="2dp" <!-- Define la elevación del MaterialCardView, lo que crea una sombra debajo. -->
        app:cardBackgroundColor="@color/shimmer_bg_color" <!-- Establece el color de fondo de la tarjeta. -->
        app:cardCornerRadius="25dp"/> <!-- Establece el radio de las esquinas redondeadas de la tarjeta. -->
    <!-- MaterialCardView funciona aquí como un 'placeholder' para una imagen o icono en un esqueleto de UI. -->

    <LinearLayout
        android:layout_width="0dp" <!-- El ancho del LinearLayout es inicialmente 0, pero se inflará en base al layout_weight. -->
        android:layout_height="wrap_content" <!-- La altura de LinearLayout solo es tan grande como el contenido que incluye. -->
        android:layout_weight="2" <!-- Da un peso relativo de 2, es decir, este LinearLayout ocupará el doble de espacio que el MaterialCardView anterior. -->
        android:orientation="vertical"> <!-- Los hijos de este LinearLayout se organizan en una columna vertical. -->

        <com.google.android.material.card.MaterialCardView
            android:layout_width="match_parent" <!-- Establece que el MaterialCardView debe coincidir con el ancho de su contenedor LinearLayout. -->
            android:layout_height="15dp" <!-- Altura fija de la tarjeta de 15dp que simula una línea de texto en el esqueleto de UI. -->
            android:layout_margin="10dp" <!-- Se aplica un margen de 10dp en todas las direcciones del MaterialCardView. -->
            app:cardBackgroundColor="@color/shimmer_bg_color" <!-- Color de fondo para la tarjeta. -->
            app:cardCornerRadius="20dp"/> <!-- Radio de las esquinas redondeadas de la tarjeta. -->
        <!-- Primer MaterialCardView que simula una línea de texto corta en un esqueleto de UI. -->

        <com.google.android.material.card.MaterialCardView
            android:layout_width="match_parent" <!-- Ancho que coincide con el del contenedor. -->
            android:layout_height="15dp" <!-- Altura fija de 15dp. -->
            android:layout_margin="10dp" <!-- Margen de 10dp en todas las direcciones. -->
            app:cardBackgroundColor="@color/shimmer_bg_color" <!-- Color de fondo. -->
            app:cardCornerRadius="20dp"/> <!-- Radio de las esquinas de 20dp. -->
        <!-- Segundo MaterialCardView que simula otra línea de texto corta en el esqueleto de UI. -->

        <com.google.android.material.card.MaterialCardView
            android:layout_width="100dp" <!-- Ancho fijo de la tarjeta de 100dp. -->
            android:layout_height="15dp" <!-- Altura fija de la tarjeta de 15dp. -->
            android:layout_margin="10dp" <!-- Margen de 10dp en todas las direcciones. -->
            app:cardBackgroundColor="@color/shimmer_bg_color" <!-- Color de fondo. -->
            app:cardCornerRadius="20dp"/> <!-- Radio de las esquinas de 20dp. -->
        <!-- Tercer MaterialCardView que simula una línea más corta como podría ser un subtítulo o fecha en el esqueleto de UI. -->
    </LinearLayout>
    <!-- Fin del LinearLayout secundario que contiene los tres MaterialCardView. -->

</LinearLayout>
<!-- Fin del LinearLayout principal que dispone horizontalmente un 'placeholder' de imagen y un grupo de 'placeholders' de texto. -->

flowchart LR
    Pedido([Pedido de Inventario]) -->|Sábado| PedidoEval(Pedido Basado en Inventario)
    PedidoEval -->|Martes| Recepcion(Recepción de Paletas)
    Recepcion --> Clasifica([Clasificación de Mercancía])
    Clasifica --> Organiza([Organizar Mercancía])
    Organiza --> Flechado([Flechar Conjuntos y Trajes de Baño])
    Flechado --> Promo([Promoción de Productos])
    Promo -->|Preparación de Publicaciones| Estrategias(Estrategias de Venta)
    Estrategias --> VentaT([Venta Tienda Física])
    Estrategias --> VentaO([Venta Online])
    VentaT --> Herramientas([Herramientas de Venta])
    VentaO --> Herramientas
    Herramientas --> Comunicacion([Comunicación Interna])
    Herramientas --> Contabilidad([Contabilidad])
    Herramientas --> RRHH([Recursos Humanos])
    Herramientas --> Bodega([Gestión de Bodega])
    Contabilidad --> RescateAnalisis{Análisis de Rescate?}
    RescateAnalisis -->|Sí| Rescate([Realizar Rescate])
    RescateAnalisis -->|No| Fin([Fin del Proceso])
    Comunicacion --> Fin
    RRHH --> Fin
    Bodega --> Fin

services:
  nginx:
    image: nginx:latest
    container_name: nginx
    ports:
      - "80:80"
      - "443:443"
    volumes:
      - /path/to/your/certs:/etc/letsencrypt
      - /path/to/your/nginx/conf.d:/etc/nginx/conf.d
    depends_on:
      - certbot
    networks:
      - webnet

  certbot:
    image: certbot/certbot
    container_name: certbot
    volumes:
      - /path/to/your/certs:/etc/letsencrypt
      - /path/to/your/certbot/www:/var/www/certbot
    entrypoint:

implement main
    open core, console, string

class facts
    parent : (string, string).
    man : (string).

class predicates
    sibling : (string, string) nondeterm.
    grand_nephew : (string, string) nondeterm.
    grand_niece : (string, string) nondeterm.
    has_cousin_Kim : (string) nondeterm.

clauses
    sibling(X, Y) :-
        parent(Z, X),
        parent(Z, Y),
        X \= Y.
    
    grand_nephew(Nephew, GrandAuntUncle) :-
        man(Nephew),
        parent(Parent, Nephew),
        sibling(Parent, AuntUncle),
        parent(GrandAuntUncle, AuntUncle),
        GrandAuntUncle \= Parent.

    grand_niece(Niece, GrandAuntUncle) :-
        parent(Parent, Niece),
        sibling(Parent, AuntUncle),
        parent(GrandAuntUncle, AuntUncle),
        GrandAuntUncle \= Parent,
        not man(Niece).

    has_cousin_Kim(Person) :-
        man("Kim"),
        parent(Parent, "Kim"),
        parent(Grandparent, Parent),
        parent(Grandparent, ParentSibling),
        Parent \= ParentSibling,
        parent(ParentSibling, Cousin),
        Cousin = Person.

clauses
    grand_nephew("Charlie", "Bob").
    grand_nephew("Daniel", "Eve").
    grand_niece("Emily", "Tom").
    parent("Alice", "Charlie").
    parent("Bob", "Alice").
    parent("Tom", "Bob").
    parent("Eve", "Kim").
    parent("Dave", "Eve").
    man("Charlie").
    man("Bob").
    man("Tom").
    man("Kim").
    man("Daniel").

clauses
run() :-
    write("Grand nephews of Bob:\n"),
    foreach(grand_nephew(GrandNephew, "Bob") do
        writef(" - %s\n", GrandNephew)
    ),
    write("\nChecking if someone has a cousin named Kim:\n"),
    foreach(has_cousin_Kim(Person) do
        writef(" - %s has a cousin named Kim.\n", Person)
    ). 

end implement main

:- dynamic man/1.
:- dynamic parent/2.

% Определяем факты о родителях и поле человека
man("Bill").
man("John").

parent("John", "Judith").
parent("Bill", "John").
parent("Pam", "Bill").

% Предикаты для мужчин и женщин
male(X) :- man(X).
female(X) :- \+ man(X).

% Определяем предикат братьев и сестёр (на самом деле полных братьев и сестёр)
sibling(X, Y) :- 
    parent(X, Z), 
    parent(Y, Z), 
    X \= Y.

% Определяем дядей или тётю
uncle_or_aunt(X, Y) :- 
    parent(Y, Z), 
    sibling(Z, X).

% Определяем внучатого племянника (должен быть мужчиной)
grand_nephew(X, Y) :-
    male(X),
    parent(Z, X), 
    uncle_or_aunt(Y, Z).

% Определяем двоюродного брата или сестру
cousin(X, Y) :- 
    parent(Z, X), 
    parent(W, Y), 
    sibling(Z, W),
    X \= Y.

% Определяем условие для проверки, есть ли у X двоюродный брат или сестра по имени Kim
has_cousin_Kim(X) :-
    cousin(Kim, X),
    Kim = "Kim".

% Тесты
:- grand_nephew(GrandNephew, "Judith"), write('Grand nephew: '), writeln(GrandNephew).
:- has_cousin_Kim("John"), writeln('John has a cousin named Kim.').

    parent(Person1, Parent),
    parent(Person2, Parent),
    Person1 \= Person2.

uncle_or_aunt(Nephew, UncleAunt) :-
    parent(Nephew, Parent),
    sibling(Parent, UncleAunt).

grand_nephew(GrandNephew, GrandAuntUncle) :-
    parent(GrandNephew, Parent),
    man(Parent),
    uncle_or_aunt(Parent, GrandAuntUncle).

man(Name) :-
    person(Name, male()).

cousin(Person, Cousin) :-
    parent(Person, Parent), 
    parent(Cousin, UnclesAunts), 
    sibling(Parent, UnclesAunts),
    Person \= Cousin.

has_cousin_Kim(Person) :-
    cousin(Person, "Kim").

sibling(A, B) :- parent(P, A), parent(P, B), A \= B.

% Универсальный предикат для поиска племянников / племянниц
niece_or_nephew(NieceNephew, Person) :- 
    sibling(Person, Parent), parent(Parent, NieceNephew).

% Отношение внучатого племянника
grand_nephew(X, Y) :-
    man(X), % Внучатый племянник должен быть мужчиной
    parent(Z, X), % Находим родителя X
    niece_or_nephew(Z, Y). % Проверяем, является ли Z племянником/племянницей Y

% Предикат для определения двоюродных братьев и сестер
cousin(X, Y) :-
    parent(A, X), 
    parent(B, Y), 
    sibling(A, B), 
    X \= Y.
